name: Gotu Kola
history: Gotu Kola is widely used in Ayurvedic and traditional Chinese medicine to improve brain function, memory, and wound healing.
pros: Enhances memory, reduces anxiety, improves skin healing.
cons: May cause dizziness or skin irritation in sensitive individuals.

name: Bhringraj
history: Traditionally known as the 'king of herbs' for hair care in Ayurveda.
pros: Promotes hair growth, supports liver health, improves skin.
cons: May cause chills or increase vata imbalance if taken in excess.

name: Punarnava
history: Used in Ayurveda for kidney support and reducing water retention.
pros: Supports kidney health, reduces inflammation, diuretic.
cons: May lead to dehydration if not taken with sufficient fluids.

name: Shankhpushpi
history: A key herb in Ayurveda used to enhance cognitive function and reduce anxiety.
pros: Improves memory, relieves stress, supports mental clarity.
cons: Mild sedative effect; may cause drowsiness in high doses.
